intro: Parosela arenaria, commonly known as the sand parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in coastal and arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Parosela arenaria is often found in open habitats such as dunes and rocky slopes.
